    question => UTF-8 string (1550) "<p>39. For any financial liability recognised at fair value, carry out the f...
    $value[38]['question']
    <p>39.	For any financial liability recognised at fair value, carry out the following procedures (as appropriate):</p>
<ul>
    <li>Ascertain how management has determined the fair value (e.g. calculated by management; counter-party valuation received; independent third party valuation received);</li>
    <li>Assess and test the bases and assumptions used to calculate/support the fair value;</li>
    <li>If management have engaged a third party valuer, undertake the appropriate audit tests on the N audit programme to determine the reliability of the evidence obtained;</li>
    <li>•	Consider the need to appoint an auditor’s expert (as per ISA 620). If this is considered necessary, complete the relevant test on the N audit programme;</li>
    <li>•	Develop your own range of estimates of the fair value and compare against those used by management for reasonableness;</li>
    <li>•	Consider whether any events subsequent to the reporting period end up to the date of the audit report provide any audit evidence</li>
</ul>
<p>NB 1: Reliance CANNOT be placed a valuation provided by the counter-party to the financial instrument. This is due to the fact that any such valuation is not independent, and in most cases, does not provide detail of the assumptions, data or models used to support the valuation. </p>
<p>NB 2: Auditors are prohibited by the IESBA Code of Ethics from providing valuation services to audit clients where the valuation involves subjectivity and the effect is material to the financial statements.</p>

    <h6>For periods commencing on or after 1 January 2019:</h6>
<p>41.	Review loans and other debt instruments held at FVTPL for any early repayment features with negative compensation (that is, the difference between the prepayment amount and unpaid amounts of principal and interest). If the negative compensation amount is “reasonable compensation for early termination of the contract”, and the loan is held to collect, the loan can now be carried at amortised cost rather than at FVTPL. </p>
<p>Where such financial assets were previously carried at FVTPL, ensure that the transition requirements per IFRS 9.7.2.29 to 34 are complied with.</p>
